Instructions.Batch File Shipping enables you to creat: The Batch File Sample tab of this worksheet contains a template you may use to help create your CSV/SSV file.
After entering your shipment data into the Batch File Sample tab, save that tab (only that tab, not the entire worksheet) as a CSV or SSV file.
The import file uses a comma/semicolon as the field delimiter. Your file must include the comma/semicolon delimiter for all fields, even for optional fields.
Column headers should not be included in your file, so delete that row prior to importing.

If a particular record fails validation during the import, the system will create an error file with the records that the system could not import. Review the report and make any corrections necessary. Once the errors have been resolved, try the import process again.
The File Specifications tab provides more detailed information about the values you may enter into each field of your batch file.
The Packaging Type Codes, Service Type Codes, and Notification Language Codes tabs provide valid codes for those fields.

File Specifications.Valid Values:

(e.g.: US=United States,JP=Japan, DE=Germany,etc.)

Address 2 for recipient (optional)
Address 3 for recipient (optional)
Recipient's city

Recipient's State or Province, if applicable

Recipient's Postal Code (ZIP Code)
Required for certain destination countries

Recipient's telephone number

Recipient's telephone extension

Recipient's Address Classification
1=Residential; 0=Commercial

Type of packaging for the shipment

If the package is contained with Lithium Ion Alone battery the column will display 1 (yes) otherwise it will be empty or 0 (Lightly Regulated Lithium Batteries was Sunset)

If the package is contained with Lithium Metal With Equipment battery the column will display 1 (yes) otherwise it will be empty or 0 (Lightly Regulated Lithium Batteries was Sunset)
NOTE: If more than 3 Lithium Battery fields are selected, the shipment is rejected, and the error message is added to the error file. (Lightly Regulated Lithium Batteries was Sunset)

Packaging Type Codes.Description: Pallet (valid only for PL to PL)

Frequent Asked Questions.Question: Do I still need to include a column for a field that is not required/not being used?
Frequent Asked Questions.Answer: Yes, you must account for any fields, even optional fields, that you are not entering details for. These columns can be left blank but must not be deleted.

Frequent Asked Questions.Question: What are the valid services and pickup days for my origin and destination?
Frequent Asked Questions.Answer: You can find service and pickup information on ups.com's Calculate Time and Cost page.

Frequent Asked Questions.Question: Why am I receiving an error for the address?
Frequent Asked Questions.Answer:
Look out for misspelled cities. Make sure you are not using street type abbreviations:
* EX: Use "suite" instead of "ste"

Frequent Asked Questions.Question: Would I receive an error if the file is incorrect?
Frequent Asked Questions.Answer: Yes, you will receive an error if format is not correct. Pay attention to any error message you receive during the Batch Import Process.

Frequent Asked Questions.Question: If I do not include required fields, will I get an error?
Frequent Asked Questions.Answer:
Yes, if you are missing a required field you will get an error. Occassionally the file will fail to import, and a field that is marked 'Not Required' will be indicated as a required field in the error message.
*Compare your file to the required fields to determine if another field marked as 'Not Required' has been filled in.
*Refer to the "Required" and "Valid Values" column on the File Specifications tab to see what may be required for your shipment.

Frequent Asked Questions.Question: Can I leave the header row in my batch file when I upload it?
Frequent Asked Questions.Answer: The header should not included in the batch file. Make sure to remove the header row if there is one before uploading your file.

Frequent Asked Questions.Question: Which fields are required when uploading the file?
Frequent Asked Questions.Answer: The file will contain required fields and optional fields in the File Specifications sheet.

Frequent Asked Questions.Question: Do I need to use a specific format with my batch file?
Frequent Asked Questions.Answer: The field data needs to be properly formatted and the file needs to be properly saved. The import file must be in a .CSV (comma separated values) or .SSV (semicolon separated values) file type.

Frequent Asked Questions.Question: Do I need to enter my fields in a specific order?
Frequent Asked Questions.Answer: The fields must be entered in your import file in the same order as they appear in the template batch file.

Frequent Asked Questions.Question: What characters are allowed within the batch file?
Frequent Asked Questions.Answer:
Review the File Specifications sheet for the allowed Field Types for each Field Name. Look for special characters that can cause issues where they are least expected, and may create errors, such as:
*parantheses
*hyphens
*periods
*quotations
*spaces

Frequent Asked Questions.Question: Are there any characters that cannot be used in the .CSV or .SSV file?
Frequent Asked Questions.Answer: Excel does not display every special character. You can open the .CSV or .SSV file in a text editor (Notepad for Windows or Notes for Apple) on your device to review the whole file and verify the file is accurate.

Frequent Asked Questions.Question: Will there be any issues if I add extra spaces into my file?
Frequent Asked Questions.Answer: Look for any cells that may include extra spaces in the data, which can cause errors. If information was copied and pasted into the .CSV or .SSV file, it may cause extra spaces.

Frequent Asked Questions.Question: Can I have a page break in my file?
Frequent Asked Questions.Answer: No, please ensure that there are no page breaks in the .CSV or .SSV file.

Frequent Asked Questions.Question: If I delete a field, would it cause any issues with my upload?
Frequent Asked Questions.Answer: If any fields have been deleted from the .CSV or .SSV file, it can cause your entries to be misaligned and create errors.

Frequent Asked Questions.Question: Will my file be validated prior to me starting the batch process?
Frequent Asked Questions.Answer: Yes, it will validate based on the file format. You may receive an error next to the file prior to submitting the file or after submitting the file. Review the file format and content if any errors are received.

Frequent Asked Questions.Question: Why am I getting an error saying my postal code or service type code is invalid?
Frequent Asked Questions.Answer: Look for zip codes, service type codes, and any other codes that require a leading zero. Open the .CSV or .SSV file in a text editor (Notepad for Windows or Notes for Apple) and ensure that the first zero is not missing.

Frequent Asked Questions.Question: Do I need to provide a Description of Goods or Unit of Measure for an international shipment?
Frequent Asked Questions.Answer: Yes, international shipments must have a Description of Goods and a Unit of Measure.

Frequent Asked Questions.Question: How do I enter a Unit of Measure?
Frequent Asked Questions.Answer: You must enter either LB for pounds or KG for kilograms.

Frequent Asked Questions.Question: Do the fields have a limit?
Frequent Asked Questions.Answer: Yes, make sure the fields do not exceed the maximum length, which can be located on the File Specifications tab. Look for any field data that exceeds the maximum characters allowed.

Frequent Asked Questions.Question: What format should I use to enter in a Country?
Frequent Asked Questions.Answer:
The valid format is to use the two-character ISO Country abbreviation.
* EX: Use "DE" instead of "Germany" or "US" instead of "United States"

Frequent Asked Questions.Question: If I am shipping to the US what do I enter for the State/Province/Other field?
Frequent Asked Questions.Answer:
The valid format is to use the two-character State abbreviation.
*EX: Use "PA" instead of "Pennsylvania" or "NJ" instead of "New Jersey"

Frequent Asked Questions.Question: Can I include extra spaces in the file?
Frequent Asked Questions.Answer: No, extra spaces in the .CSV or .SSV file will create errors if it exceeds the limits of the File Specifications fields.

Frequent Asked Questions.Question: Can I include commas in my fields, such as in my address?
Frequent Asked Questions.Answer: Please do not include any commas in any of your fields. Including commas will cause an error when your file is processed.

Frequent Asked Questions.Question: Can I make batch shipments with SurePost services?
Frequent Asked Questions.Answer: Yes, as long as you are shipping with an account with a SurePost contract, you can make batch shipments with SurePost services.
